snippet: Law enforcement and anti-racist activists should pay close attention to the neo-Nazi music scene as a motivating force for hate crime.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Profs Robert Futrell and Pete Simi cites Wade M Page's shooting rampage at a Wisconsin Sikh temple as an example of how white power extremism can thrive in hidden places of hate; notes Page, like many of the 50,000 neo-Nazis in the country, was deeply involved in a music scene that nurtures virulent racism.

byline.original: By ROBERT FUTRELL and PETE SIMI

lead_paragraph: Law enforcement and anti-racist activists should pay close attention to the neo-Nazi music scene as a motivating force for hate crime.

headline.seo: The Sikh Temple Killer’s Music of Hate
